Description: Handle-plate sherd with part of rim and neck of Corinthian black-figured pottery column-krater; inside of neck glazed; underside of plate reserved, edges glazed; on top: partly preserved band framing picture; black-figure decoration consisting of siren facing right, looking back, wearing fillet on head and with outspread wings; added red on lower part of face and neck, alternate bands on wings and alternate feathers; the black on top of head and wings has flaked off but brown outline remains.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Ashmolean Museum, Oxford. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: Venit 1982 / Painted Pottery from the Greek Mainland found in Egypt, 640-450 BC (p. 112, no. A184) (with no registration number)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GB.052) (Phase 1)
Previous owner: Currently owned by: Ashmolean Museum, University of Oxford
